line_1: The robe of purple light he lends
line_2: BROAD in the west the sun descends,

line_1: Just so; the house a shelter lends,
line_2: Within I find the best of friends,

line_1: But as the greatest Blessing Heaven lends,
line_2: May be Debauch'd, and serve Ignoble Ends:

line_1: He who uncall'd his succour lends;
line_2: Th' officious power my call attends,

line_1: Sweet Love their Looks a gentle Radiance lends,
Sweet Love their Looks a gentle Radiance lends,
line_2: And with seraphic Flame Compassion blends.

line_1: Sweet Love their Looks a gentle Radiance lends,
line_2: When lo! a goodly Hospital ascends;

line_1: And yon kind cloud her golden curtain lends:
line_2: But see! the sun the steep of heaven descends,
Her Braided Hair to make thee Ends;

line_1: And forms a friendly telescope, that lends
line_2: Close to his eyes his hat he instant bends,

line_1: Then close consulting, each his talent lends
line_2: To plan fresh sports when tedious service ends.

line_1: The half-stript hedge a sorry shelter lends.
line_2: Keen blows the blast, or ceaseless rain descends;

line_1: And show-like Fancy all her colouring lends,
line_2: To gild those views that opened with our friends:

line_1: "Life's sun, we read, when heaven a respite lends,
line_2: " Ten degrees back against the shade descends. "

line_1: The opening door a willing shelter lends,
line_2: For here sweet Innocence and Man were friends;
